metadata.title: CVE-2022-48903 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:btrfs: fix relocation crash due to premature return frombtrfs_commit_transaction()We are seeing crashes similar to the following trace:[38.969182] WARNING: CPU: 20 PID: 2105 at fs/btrfs/relocation.c:4070btrfs_relocate_block_group+0x2dc/0x340 [btrfs][38.973556] CPU: 20 PID: 2105 Comm: btrfs Not tainted 5.17.0-rc4 #54[38.974580] Hardware name: QEMU Standard PC (i440FX + PIIX, 1996), BIOSrel-1.12.0-59-gc9ba5276e321-prebuilt.qemu.org 04/01/2014[38.976539] RIP: 0010:btrfs_relocate_block_group+0x2dc/0x340 [btrfs][38.980336] RSP: 0000:ffffb0dd42e03c20 EFLAGS: 00010206[38.981218] RAX: ffff96cfc4ede800 RBX: ffff96cfc3ce0000 RCX:000000000002ca14[38.982560] RDX: 0000000000000000 RSI: 4cfd109a0bcb5d7f RDI:ffff96cfc3ce0360[38.983619] RBP: ffff96cfc309c000 R08: 0000000000000000 R09:0000000000000000[38.984678] R10: ffff96cec0000001 R11: ffffe84c80000000 R12:ffff96cfc4ede800[38.985735] R13: 0000000000000000 DR6: 00000000fffe0ff0 DR7:0000000000000400[38.992528] Call Trace:[38.992854]  <TASK>[38.993148]  btrfs_relocate_chunk+0x27/0xe0 [btrfs][38.993941]  btrfs_balance+0x78e/0xea0 [btrfs][38.994801]  ? vsnprintf+0x33c/0x520[38.995368]  ? __kmalloc_track_caller+0x351/0x440[38.996198]  btrfs_ioctl_balance+0x2b9/0x3a0 [btrfs][38.997084]  btrfs_ioctl+0x11b0/0x2da0 [btrfs][38.997867]  ? mod_objcg_state+0xee/0x340[38.998552]  ? seq_release+0x24/0x30[38.999184]  ? proc_nr_files+0x30/0x30[38.999654]  ? call_rcu+0xc8/0x2f0[39.000228]  ? 00007f11c1521698 RCX:00007f11c166959b[39.009833] RDX: 00007fff2543ea40 RSI: 00000000c4009420 RDI:0000000000000003[39.011270] RBP: 0000000000000003 R08: 0000000000000013 R09:00007f11c16f94e0[39.012581] DR2:0000000000000000[43.149581] DR3: 0000000000000000 DR6: 00000000fffe0ff0 DR7: 00000000000---truncated---

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48903` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.2').
